resources.string: My name is Arnav Singhal and I am from Delhi, India. I am 16 years old and interested in entrepreneurship and engineering. I want to change the world by solving global challenges that are currently plaguing the world. I thus took the initiative to take part in this project which will take the world one step closer to being a better place. I am coordinating research and presentation in the project which is crucial and makes this dear to me.

I am a passionate Pan-African blogger writer and tech enthusiast from Uganda. My hobbies are rugby, chess and Netflix and chill. If you don\'t find me penning my thoughts, I am probably developing code for personal projects as well as friends\'. I am therefore tasked with developing an android application for our project, to help solve logistical issues involved in management of waste that has drastically increased during the covid-19 pandemic.

Mask-cycle is designed to raise the awareness of waste management problems. The app is designed to help the problem of recycling masks because of the pandemic, that increased the demand for use. The company’s mission is to increase recycling and therefore serve for the better good

My name is Dachi Gvinadze and I’m from Georgia. I’m 17 years old and interested in STEM. Today’s world faces many global problems and resolving them is vital for future developments. I’m in charge of creating ways to reduce waste and enhance recycling throughout the world. The ideas have to be innovative, reliable, easily implementable, and realistic.

My name is Miffy Wang. I am 17 and from Hong Kong. I study in Massachusetts’s and consider myself a global citizen. I am passionate about global issues stemming from climate change to Asian discrimination. In addition I am fascinated with the arts, specifically aligning in the digital realm. I’m in charge of graphic design and social marketing. From my experience in the field I am hoping to make an impact and bring this project into life.
